Design Patterns - Observer

Pattern Name

Observer

Description

Define an one-to-many dependency between objects so that when one object changes state, all its dependents are notified and updated automatically. A more simple way to explain it is to say that Observer pattern is just the Publish / Subscribe relationship, so we have one publisher or subject, and one or more subscribers or observers. Each subscriber has to subscribe to a publisher, and observe it. When a publisher publish something, all observers will receive the message. It is like a Twitter. When you start to follow some one you will become a subscriber, and the followed is the publisher. If this person publish something, you and all other subscribers will receive the publication.

Problem

The problem is to send a message to an innumerable number of objects. The object which send the message don't know how much objects are, and who they are. Beyond that is necessary doesn't have a relationship among publisher and subscribers, the coupling has to be weak.

Solution

The solution is to create a publisher which sends a message to a collections of subscribers which subscribed to receive it. The publisher don't knows who are the subscribers, and the subscribers can unsubscribe to receive the message in any moment.

Consequences

  • publisher can never send a message, and the subscribers can wait for that in vain;
  • publisher can send the same message repeatedly, and subscriber has to deal for that;
  • publisher can send messages very quickly, and subscriber has to be prepared to that;
  • publisher can have a strong coupling with subscribers because of the subscription process, and it can avoid the Garbage Collection remove old objects from memory;

Examples

  • C#
